text:
*[Bug 18806] r-devel check_rust() not behind `--as-cran` flag*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18806>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch

--- Comment #2 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
It should really be an R-core + CRAN-team decision, not the users' to say which
bugs/problems should be raised on which level.

Note that there are R (<-> R-core) decisions on undesirable issues to be noted
with  'R CMD check' and yes, they're often correlated with corresponding
CRAN-team decisions,  but I think you are incorrect in claiming 
  _"this is a cran policy check, it should be behind the --as-cran flag."_ 

Also, bug reports about "R-devel" are inappropriate, as "R devel" includes
"unstable" as you can see in the very first line of the startup messages
*every* time you use R-devel, e.g.,
```
R Under development (unstable) (2024-10-14 r87233) -- "Unsuffered Consequences"
```

It's okay to raise an issue here (R Bugzilla), but I even doubt your
classification as __major__ (notably combined with minimal priority P5 ...).

As it has be said on R-devel
<https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/r-devel/2024-October/083668.html> your report is
about a version of R that is unreleased and will not be released for another
several months.  We will deal with the issue in due time.
